newsitem.title: USA: TSX sees Q2 results below estimates.
newsitem.headline: TSX sees Q2 results below estimates.

text.p: TSX Corp said on Wednesday it expected its operating results for the second fiscal quarter ended October 26 to be "substantially" less than analysts' estimates.

TSX said the lower operating results were a result of several factors, including the announcement by the company's largest customer that shipments are to be stopped until further notice. It did not name the customer.

The company said its potential merger partner has been made aware of the expectations and merger talks are continuing. Earlier this month Antec Corp said it and TSX were discussing a combination of the two companies in a conversion of shares.

TSX said if the hold of shipments by the customer remains in effect materially into the third fiscal quarter it could cause a reduction in the company's earnings in that quarter and until the customer ends the stoppage.

TSX also said it reduced the scale of the company's advertising insertion business segment and received a substantial portion of the second quarter's order input late in the quarter which made it unavailable for shipment in the second quarter.
Headquartered in El Paso, Texas, TSX, through its Texscan subsidiary, manufactures CATV fiber optic and RF distribution electronics and electronic advertising insertion equipment.
